Author: marginally_offended
Text: Telling her will be scary, but you can do it. I don't have an eating disorder, but my sister struggles with bulimia as well as some binge eating. She never opened up about it, but I always knew and was so so worried about her health. That isn't the case with everyone, but there is a chance your mom already knows something's up and is waiting for you to be ready to open up about it. My sister is working on getting better, and it's a lot easier now that we can all support her with recovery instead of keeping it as a secret/ ignoring it. Recovery is hard, but your mom will be happy to work with you to keep you healthy and get you the help you need.  Merry Christmas!

Author: itsqueerinhere
Text: I don't have any advice because my parents caught me years ago as a teen and now they just know my signs of relapse but I'm an adult now so they can't stop me. Maybe just wait for a quiet/calm time to sit and have a discussion, highlight your health problems & concerns. Really sorry I don't have any advice but I just hope it goes well for you. You deserve peace ‚ù§
